item.title: Neuro-Generated Content (NGC)
item.description: Neuro-Generated Content: Legal Framework Proposal Definition Neuro-Generated Content (NGC) refers to creative works produced through the interpretation and transformation of human neural signals (EEG, fMRI, or other brain-computer interface data) by artificial intelligence systems. Unlike purely AI-generated content, NGC explicitly recognizes the human brain as an active co-creator in the generative process, establishing a hybrid authorship model. Key Principles 1. Dual Authorship Recognition NGC operates under a collaborative creation model where:
